===Origin===
During his long life, [[James Howlett (Earth-616)|Wolverine]] met and fell in love with many women and, unknown to him, he also fathered a number of children. Those children were found through the years by another of Logan's sons, [[Akihiro (Earth-616)|Daken]].
 
Daken then gave them to an evil organization who wanted revenge on Wolverine for what he did to them in the past: [[Red Right Hand (Earth-616)|the Red Right Hand]]. On Daken’s advice, the Red Right Hand trained them in order to use them as weapons against Logan, but knowing perfectly that they wouldn't stand a chance against him. Their training completed, the Red Right Hand named them '''The Mongrels'''.{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 14}}

===Vendetta against Wolverine===
The Mongrels became a group of mercenaries whose main mission was to make Wolverine's life a living hell. The plan was to cause as much suffering imaginable, and that included the torture of his friends and family. The Mongrels were led by [[William Downing (Earth-616)|Gunhawk]] and the rest of the team includes [[Shadow S. (Earth-616)|Shadowstalker]], [[Fire Knives (Earth-616)|Fire Knives]], [[Saw Fist (Earth-616)|Saw Fist]], and [[Cannon Foot (Earth-616)|Cannon Foot]].

One of the team's targets was Wolverine's girlfriend at the time, [[Melita Garner (Earth-616)|Melita Garner]]. They found her working in the [[San Francisco]] Post building.{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 1}} When they found and attacked Melita, they were shocked to find her with a Skrull sonic disruptor, which she fired at the team. Melita escaped from the Mongrels with the help of the mutant shape shifter [[Raven Darkholme (Earth-616)|Mystique]]. The team returned to report their failure to the The Red Right Hand. They then decided to proceed to their next target in the nation of [[Madripoor]].{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 1}}

After they arrived in Madripoor, The Mongrels searched the city to find the [[Princess Bar]]. They entered the bar and massacred the bouncers and staff, but [[Jessán Hoan (Earth-616)|Tyger Tiger]] intervened when Gunhawk tried to open a certain door. Gunhawk told Tyger "Logan is in hell," and burned the room down, which was filled with mementos and possessions that Wolverine had accumulated over his long lifetime.{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 4}}

===Final Revenge===
After escaping from [[Hell]], Wolverine invaded the Red Right Hand's base, where he was confronted by the Mongrels.{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 10}} Despite what they did to his friends, he gave each one of them a chance to surrender peacefully but the Mongrels attacked him on sight and tried to kill him. As a result Logan killed most of them,{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 10}}{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 11}}{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 13}} while the others killed themselves;{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 12}} and after defeating the leader of the Mongrels, [[William Downing (Earth-616)|Gunhawk]], Logan confronted the members of the Red Right Hand.{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 13}} 

To his surprise, the members of the Red Right Hand had already killed themselves, leaving Wolverine with only a message: the Mongrels were his children. This revelation and the fact that he killed his own children devastated Logan.{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 14}} Wolverine then dragged the bodies of his slain children to the grave of their mothers and buried them both together.{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 15}}

It's unknown if The Mongrels were aware that Daken was their half-brother and Logan their father, as the Red Right Hand and Daken only told them what was necessary to make them fight and die against their own father.{{r|Wolverine Vol 4 14}}
